undertaking noun [C]
(IN VEHICLE)
[ U ] UK the act of passing another vehicle that is going in the same direction as you by driving past it on the left side: Undertaking in itself isn't illegal, but you could face a fixed penalty notice for careless driving. Undertaking in the inside lane should be avoided wherever possible.
More examplesFewer examplesThey suggested that one way to relieve congestion would be to introduce undertaking on all stretches of motorway with three or more lanes.
